`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.p,{children:`As you already know, GraphQL is a query language for APIs. It is a declarative language, which means that it is easy to write queries. However, it is also a flexible language, which means that it is easy to write queries that are not declarative. This guide will help you to write declarative queries. Until now, you have created a server that returns data. However, you have not used the data in any way. This guide will help you to use the data in a declarative way.\r
GraphQL clients are used to send queries to a GraphQL server. Requests are sent in the form of a query string. The response is returned in the form of a JSON object. The response is a JSON object that contains the data that is requested. Request are made to a GraphQL server using HTTP protocol, so you can use the same client as a client for RESTful APIs.`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-6564c444-2780-448a-856e-018bfebecc64.mdx",lineNumber:13,columnNumber:1},this),`

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.p,{children:[`IDE's are test tools to check the correctness of your queries. You can define your queries in the IDE and then send them to the server. The server will return the data that is requested if the query is correct. There are a lot of IDEs available.\r
The most popular and the simplest IDE for GraphQL queries is `,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.a,{href:"https://www.graphqleditor.com/",children:"GraphiQL"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-6564c444-2780-448a-856e-018bfebecc64.mdx",lineNumber:21,columnNumber:62},this),`.\r
The modern clone of GraphiQL is `,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.a,{href:"https://www.electronjs.org/apps/graphql-playground",children:"GraphQL Playground"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-6564c444-2780-448a-856e-018bfebecc64.mdx",lineNumber:22,columnNumber:33},this),`. The enviroment is cleaner and has some advanced features.\r
The recent one IDE for GraphQL queries is `,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.a,{href:"https://studio.apollographql.com/",children:"Apollo Explorer"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-6564c444-2780-448a-856e-018bfebecc64.mdx",lineNumber:23,columnNumber:43},this),`.\r

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.h2,{id:"react-relay",children:[(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.a,{"aria-hidden":"true",tabIndex:"-1",href:"#react-relay",children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.span,{className:"icon icon-link"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-6564c444-2780-448a-856e-018bfebecc64.mdx"},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-6564c444-2780-448a-856e-018bfebecc64.mdx"},this),"React-Relay"]},void 0,!0,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-6564c444-2780-448a-856e-018bfebecc64.mdx",lineNumber:504,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.p,{children:`Relay is a GraphQL client which is built by Facebook. It is a great GraphQL client, but it is not a good choice for simple applications and beginners. It is highly opinionated, users must follow the strict rules.\r
The main thing here is that the error possibility is minimal. Contrary to other clients it misses a lot of flexibility. Relay demands a lot of knowledge about the application and schema design.\r
The shiny point is that it is awesome for scalability. Relay is a complete framework for declarative data fetching.\r
To be able to use Relay, one must create a GraphQL server compatible with Relay.\r
Many developers avoid using Relay and instead use Apollo Client for complex applications, due to its simplicity and flexibility. It is hard to set up compared to other frameworks, but when everything is done, it is less error-prone and can be used in production serving a lot of users.\r
The big advantage of React Relay is that it is supported by Facebook and is tested by millions of users on their social networks. In the new release of React18, the Suspense feature is deeply integrated with Relay. So, if you are using React for your application, with Relay you can get a great performance boost.`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-6564c444-2780-448a-856e-018bfebecc64.mdx",lineNumber:506,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.p,{children:"From the official documentation:"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-6564c444-2780-448a-856e-018bfebecc64.mdx",lineNumber:513,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.p,{children:"Relay is composed of three core parts:"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-6564c444-2780-448a-856e-018bfebecc64.mdx",lineNumber:515,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.blockquote,{children:[`
`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.ul,{children:[`
`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.li,{children:[(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.em,{children:"Relay Compiler"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-6564c444-2780-448a-856e-018bfebecc64.mdx",lineNumber:517,columnNumber:5},this),": A GraphQL to GraphQL optimizing compiler, providing general utilities for transforming and optimizing queries as well as generating build artifacts. A novel feature of the compiler is that it facilitates experimentation with new GraphQL features - in the form of custom directives - by making it easy to translate code using these directives into standard, spec-compliant GraphQL."]},void 0,!0,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-6564c444-2780-448a-856e-018bfebecc64.mdx",lineNumber:517,columnNumber:3},this),`
`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.li,{children:[(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.em,{children:"Relay Runtime"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-6564c444-2780-448a-856e-018bfebecc64.mdx",lineNumber:518,columnNumber:5},this),': A full-featured, high-performance GraphQL runtime that can be used to build higher-level client APIs. The runtime features a normalized object cache, optimized "write" and "read" operations, a generic abstraction for incrementally fetching field data (such as for pagination), garbage collection for removing unreferenced cache entries, optimistic mutations with arbitrary logic, support for building subscriptions and live queries, and more.']},void 0,!0,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-6564c444-2780-448a-856e-018bfebecc64.mdx",lineNumber:518,columnNumber:3},this),`
`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.li,{children:[(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.em,{children:"React/Relay"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-6564c444-2780-448a-856e-018bfebecc64.mdx",lineNumber:519,columnNumber:5},this),": A high-level product API that integrates the Relay Runtime with React. This is the primary public interface to Relay for most product developers, featuring APIs to fetch the data for a query or define data dependencies for reusable components (e.g. useFragment)."]},void 0,!0,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-6564c444-2780-448a-856e-018bfebecc64.mdx",lineNumber:519,columnNumber:3},this),`

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.p,{children:`At the end of this comprehensive guide, you will learn how to use Apollo Client to fetch data from a GraphQL server.\r
Apollo is a gold standard between the GraphQL ecosystem and React. It's simple, powerful, and flexible. It has a lot of features for modern applications. The downside is the bigger size of the library. It is not convenient to use this "mega" library for a simple application.\r
Apollo is a platform-agnostic client. It can be used with any framework on the client-side, as well as with vanilla JavaScript. Works well with TypeScript and serverless architectures. Works well with Node.js and supports many libraries.`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-6564c444-2780-448a-856e-018bfebecc64.mdx",lineNumber:669,columnNumber:1},this),`

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.p,{children:`|           | [graphql-request] | [graphql-hooks] |      [urql]       |  [React-Relay]  | [apollo-client] |\r

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.p,{children:`The table above shows that GraphQL-request and urql are overall the most balanced libraries. There are no extreme results in any of these two clients.\r
Apollo-client is the most popular client in the community. On the other hand, it has the most issues.\r
GraphQL-hooks is the least popular client in the community. That's not suggesting that is the bad solution for your application.\r
GraphQL-request is the most downloaded client, so it speaks for itself.`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-6564c444-2780-448a-856e-018bfebecc64.mdx",lineNumber:758,columnNumber:1},this),`

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.p,{children:`Axios, React-Query, and SWR are great tools for any protocol and can be used to build a GraphQL client. My focus is on the protocol-specific GraphQL clients.\r
The GraphQL clients presented in this post, are all pretty solid and have a lot of good features. You can find a lot of comparison tables and examples of how to use the GraphQL clients on the internet. But this post aims to show you practical examples, with the same query and different GraphQL clients. I think that the best way to learn is to try it out on the same workload and see how it works.`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-6564c444-2780-448a-856e-018bfebecc64.mdx",lineNumber:765,columnNumber:1},this),`

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.p,{children:"We defined the PostType and the Query type. The PostType is used to define the data that the server can return. `,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.p,{children:`Data is defined in the data.js file. You can find the data in the Github repository.\r

Based on the name, the asyncIterator method of the pubsub object is called and sends the event to the client. In the end, it remains to create a server to implement the subscription.`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-58884c62-3160-4a13-a26f-57c3fca6ba7a.mdx",lineNumber:343,columnNumber:1},this),`
